website_summaries.verdict: Basic color printer that comes at an affordable price point. Provides quality print jobs in color and black and white.
pros: Sleek looking device that’s small in size and is very lightweight
Easy to set up and start using, all users have to do is “plug in and print”
Ink cartridge conveniently included with purchase
Works well with Windows or Mac computers
cons: Does not come with USB cable, which must be purchased separately

customer_reviews.title: It's small and fits nicely on the end table close to my tablet
customer_reviews.text: HP is always a safe buy. For the price this printer does the job. HP tech support helped me set it up to operate with my tablet/laptop. It did not have a cd port, so I needed help. They were very patient with me, as I am 78. This unit cannot be used to scan or copy, just basic printing. It's small and fits nicely on the end table close to my tablet.
customer_reviews.author: L. Wallace

customer_reviews.title: No Usb cable included, but easy set up and simple printer
customer_reviews.text: Very simple to use, gets the job done. Only downside is that there is no usb cable included, it should say that in the description. However, usb cable is relatively cheap just keep in mind to purchase it while you purchase the printer, so you're not stuck waiting and additional couple of days. It comes with a black and color cartridge and the printer itself is very easy to set up. If your computer doesn't have a disk player to download the software (I have a tablet with a keyboard), it's ok because you can just download the software from the company's site which is linked to you in the instructions manual.
customer_reviews.author: Kishon Greer

customer_reviews.title: great price!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this just a few weeks ago. The price is amazing and it came with ink so there's a plus. You do have to order a cord to connect it to your computer. Make sure you order the right cord! We've used it just a handful of times but each time has been great. It works well with my avery stickers and the colors come out great. Our set up went perfectly, I read that some people had some issues but I didn't experience any, read the instructions and everything should go fine!
customer_reviews.author: jessie

customer_reviews.title: Just Print my page please!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I've always wanted a printer that just prints. I don't want a reminder to buy ink or anything else. Just Print my page please! Seems to be working out in this respect. Update: I replaced the cartridges today with new ones. No setup and just started printing. This is best printer I have ever owned. Update: The cartridges do not contain as much ink as one would expect. I'm tossing out the printers. I can do better. I still like certain things about the printer but it is to expensive to print at home. I'm changing my rating.
customer_reviews.author: Slick

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Trash
customer_reviews.text: A horrible piece of trash. Will not connect to computer - tried all day - and HP has no number of a human who will get on the phone to help me. Stay away from this once fine company. Their "virtual assistant" isn't even someone looking at the questions you send -- it just mimics what is already on its "how to" pages on the website (which of course I've tried), and it blocks any hope of getting a real answer. Never again, HP, never again!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy T

customer_reviews.title: Does not feed paper
customer_reviews.text: Needed a small low cost printer for my home office and this seemed to be a decent one. I received it and paper didnt feed unless I manually fed a single page in at a time. I just decided to deal with it because I dont usually pring more than 2 or 3 pages at a time at most. Now 5 months later it prints uneven or sometimes not at all. Just a solid white page after trying to print. A little pissed now. I should have returned it as soon as I got it.
customer_reviews.author: qsmith78

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money - Broke the second use
customer_reviews.text: Setup the printer, printed a test page and figured I was good to go. The first time then using the printer (to print a 2 page black and white doc) it stopped working. It jammed. I fixed the jam and now it won't print. I knew it was a cheapo printer when I bought it, but knowing I wasn't using it for work and I'm no longer a student figured it would suffice for the occasional at-home print job. Would have rather spent the $20 more to get a printer that works.
customer_reviews.author: KJay

customer_reviews.title: NOT RECOMMENDED
customer_reviews.text: AWFUL. See the scan of a return label I tried printing on it under different settings. The ones printed using the color setting, either at normal or best quality (settings) were not usable ie they didn't generate distinct or solid enough bar codes. The label printed using the black & white setting at best quality was only OK. As you can see in the scan, the return bar code printed under that setting (to be included inside of the package) is clearly missing "horizontal" stripes of print. I uploaded a large jpg of the scan. Let me know if you can't enlarge and I'll upload each label scan as separate files. I'm not sure I can return this.
customer_reviews.author: consumer

customer_reviews.title: WORST PRINTER EVER!!️!!️!!️
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could have a “do-over,” because if I did, I would have never, EVER purchased this piece of JUNK!! Nothing but problems, error messages, and still impossible to even print a test page! I’ve never written such a scathing review, but this item deserves it. And since I inserted the color cartridges, I can’t even return it. I’d say everyone would do better to add $10-$20 to your printer cost and get something that won’t end up in the garbage the next day.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer J. Texas

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t come with a vital part
customer_reviews.text: The printer doesn’t come with a usb cord so you can’t even use it! Totally pointless waste of money, I bought it to save myself a trip to Best Buy and now I have to go to Best Buy to find a usb cord so I can actually connect the darn printer to my computer. I’ve never been so disappointed with a product from amazon before.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Koch

customer_reviews.title: 20 pages in (in 2 months) I really like this printer
customer_reviews.text: 20 pages in (in 2 months) I really like this printer. You need to buy the cord as I had read on reviews but it was cheap. I just use it for shipping labels... I recommend it all day for similar use. I just ship things from Ebay on the side... Maybe 10 things a month. If I was doing around 100+ items a month I would invest in something better probably. But with that said... I still really like this printer so far.
customer_reviews.author: Michael St George

customer_reviews.title: This is Junk. I used it probably 10 times ...
customer_reviews.text: This is Junk. I used it probably 10 times in the last few months and now it doesn't work. My last Deskjet lasted over 10 years. It wont load paper anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Brooks Becker

customer_reviews.title: Amazon: "Reliable USB connection to your computer" -- but no USB cable included!
customer_reviews.text: Both HP and Amazon are guilty for misleading buyers: It does NOT clearly say that you have to buy a separate USB cable to make this printer work. Instead, the description says, "Reliable USB connection to your computer" - which gives the impression that the cable is included. Bad move. And HP is being cheap and deceptive -- bad move. My 76 year old mother is without a working printer, so thanks a bunch.
customer_reviews.author: pat sherwin

customer_reviews.title: That is in the fine print. We went to Walmart and got the ...
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't come with the cable that it needs to hook up to laptops. That is in the fine print. We went to Walmart and got the cord it needed--3 hours later, still cannot get it to work with either of our ASUS or DELL Laptops. Apparently, our PC's are too new for the compatibility Wasted our money.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Great printer for house use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and comes with ink cartridges, the only problem is it doesn't include the usb
customer_reviews.author: Jose Aguilar

customer_reviews.title: lasted about 18 months
customer_reviews.text: Printer is now printing blank sheets , bought new ink and can't get it to work. Never printed great but ok. lasted about 18 months of light use. started printing very poorly , the print was very light, a couple months ago and just got worse. Guess you get what you pay for, this is a throw away printer after the first ink cartridge I guess
customer_reviews.author: J. G.

customer_reviews.title: Worked once and then never again
customer_reviews.text: Loved it for the first time I used it earlier this month. Went to use it today and it started printing with missing lines and asking for an alignment. Followed the directions but it made me do it over and over and never fixed itself. Waste of time, money, ink, and paper. Sent it back
customer_reviews.author: Atlanta Shopper

customer_reviews.title: A great simple printer
customer_reviews.text: I live in the middle of nowhere with no service and trying to find a basic plug in printer was so much harder than expected. This is a simple printer - no wireless connection - no Bluetooth - just plug it in and it prints. The ink it came with is actually great , I've printed about 20 so far with no issues. I'm very happy with it! It's very compact as well which is a bonus. My ONLY complaint is that it needs a USB 2.0 cord that I assumed would come with jt. It does not and I had to go order one. So don't forget the cord , because unless you have one lying around it's useless
customer_reviews.author: kamryn anderson

customer_reviews.title: GREAT!!
customer_reviews.text: I literally received my printer a half hour ago, got it set up in about 2 minutes (on the hp website, not with a disc) and printed out 46 pages of a black and white cross stitch chart. Print is very clear (not museum quality, but very adequate) and the ink is still going strong. For someone who is very technologically illiterate it was extremely easy and straight-forward. Couldn't be more pleased. It will be perfect for my limited printing needs.
customer_reviews.author: sammygirl

customer_reviews.title: Disposable printer - waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT buy. I used this printer maybe a total of 5 times before it stopped working and now it just sits in the corner of my desk. The printer will not suck paper in through the top and therefore won’t work at all.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Seward

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was buying a different type of printer, but thats not why i gave it one star, its because it says usb not included, ok i got usb canles at home, but the input from the priter is not usb is kinda of a squared input, which it doesnt ressemble any of my available cables. This product is too expensive to not be a all in one and to need a usb to be able to print!
customer_reviews.author: Yaily

customer_reviews.title: Constant No Paper and Bad, Bad Print Quality
customer_reviews.text: Had this printer for not even a year, have used it maybe 4 times. From the get go, it constantly thinks it's out of paper. I hear the wheels a turning and I see the paper, what's the problem? Started out printing fine, than comes tax time, I need to print my taxes. It must have sensed how important this was and tried to be funny, all it would print is some streaking black lines Good joke, haha. I've got a hammer and I'm itching to use it. Nope, no more HP, I'm done with your brand. Save yourself the frustration, don't buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly DeLancey

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for -- cheap mess
customer_reviews.text: This printer was a total piece of sh*t. Sad, but you get what you pay for I guess. The paper doesn't properly go through the printer; it's always getting stuck or caught. Even when the paper does make it through, the printing is off center and doesn't all get on the page. I've tried many times to make adjustments and spent hours on the phone with an equally incompetent customer service department. What a waste of money and time! I am so disappointed. Definitely do not buy this. It's worth spending more to get something that works properly.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: 3 pieces of paper, 1 print.
customer_reviews.text: If you want a printer that pulls 3 sheets of paper for every time that it prints, and no matter how many times you reset it, or insert one piece of a paper at a time - this is it! You get what you pay for, this is trash. Not even worth returning, they would just refurbish it and resell it to some other poor sucker. So, I simply smashed it on the ground and threw it in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: MK P

customer_reviews.title: Lack of instructions
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t even got it to install yet. The instructions left out steps. The CD left out steps. The manufacturers website is an absolute disorganized nightmare and after 15 minutes of fighting the website I discovered I need to get my computer online to download drivers which wasn’t stated in the instructions or the set up using the disc. Which means I have to go someplace to use public WiFi since I don’t have internet at home. I don’t understand why the installation disc doesn’t have everything needed.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Zero Stars really Piece of Junk shame on U HP!
customer_reviews.text: Unboxed printer Cables up Installed software Printer is worthless Does not work Paper feeds left side only Paper jambs and stalls Feeder roller warped will not feed but 2 inches the stalls Not field repairable Really really dis-satisfied! Junk Guess no body cares at “A”!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ken blevins

customer_reviews.title: Comepletely unusable
customer_reviews.text: The printer didn't work at all. I followed the instructions for set up, followed all of the troubleshooting protocol, and I couldn't get it to print a single document-- not even an alignment page. Everytime I attempted to use the printer, the page feeding mechanism clicks and turns-- over and over. The troubleshooting software says there's a paperjam when there's not even any paper in the printer!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Webb

customer_reviews.title: Total Garbage. NO USB CORD
customer_reviews.text: Nowhere does it state that this printer does not come with the cord to connect it to the computer. I live in the mountains and have nowhere to buy the cord, so i was screwed when it arrived, and i couldnt print the things i needed badly to print. It is also very flimsy and feels like a toy. Will be sending back. YOU CAN DO BETTER . Get the comparable Canon one
customer_reviews.author: flexiest

customer_reviews.title: Good little printer.
customer_reviews.text: All I needed was a simple printer that the family could use. No need for copying, scanning, faxing...blah...blah..blah... So this little printer was a perfect fit. Works great. Nothing special, but awesome in it's lack of specialness. Simple, no frills, does the job. Mine didn't come with a printer to USB cable, so you may need to grab one of those. I just used the one off the dead printer that this one replaces.
customer_reviews.author: William W.

customer_reviews.title: Good printer
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about this printer after reading reviews. I got it to replace another hp all in one I got for $20 at a tag sale, and thankfully I had the usb cable from that because it’s a bit annoying this didn’t come with one. Otherwise it’s been working just fine! Although it does not make copies - there’s a great app for your phone (at least iPhone not sure what else) called cam scanner where you take a photo of a document and it turns it into a pdf. Email it to yourself and print as many copies as you need! App is a lifesaver. Can’t go wrong with a $25 printer
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Garrison

customer_reviews.title: Great printer great price!
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I needed to print on transparency for screen printing but I have a pretty tight budget. I was worried this would not work do to how cheap it was, but to my suprise it works better than I expected! There is no designated transparency setting when you go to print but I have been using the glossy paper setting on the best quality and it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: beware of  tech support when trying to connect this printer!!!
customer_reviews.text: during installation the person began talking very fast and I heard something about a technician and 99.00 to get connected. wanted me to say yes ( just say yes he repeated ). I replied why would I pay 99.00 to get hooked up when I paid 29.99 for the printer. He hung up on me. He kept asking how old is computer. I told him it was purchased in the spring. Just be careful!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It looked like the ink cartridge bracket was missing
customer_reviews.text: This is my first new printer I've purchased. I'm a novice. It looked like the ink cartridge bracket was missing. Turns out it was all the way in the corner, hidden from view. I returned the printer, when explaining the problem with a phone call would have solved the problem. I returned the printer needlessly. Talking to a knowledgeable person could have prevented a waste of time and money. Detailed instructions for a novice would have helped, or maybe I'm too ignorant to find the instructions in the included materials. Whatever the inconvenience, I glad I have a good printer. Thank you. The service was excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like a toy sold without the batteries; just plain disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Upon receiving the printer and unboxing I was pleased with the sleek design and condition of the product however then I tried to get it up and working. That was a nightmare. The printer is not able to connect to wifi and although briefly mentioned in the description is not made clear that the cost of the printer doesn't include the cost of the things you'll need to actually make it print. Additionally, it cannot copy or scan anything at all, which is also not made clear. This printer would be fine if it included all the parts or did the things that are standard of most printers these days.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: This is the biggest piece of junk. You can only print one picture at a time, you have to keep turning it on and off to print again
customer_reviews.author: Smacko51

customer_reviews.title: A really good printer for non-technical people.
customer_reviews.text: Economical replacement for my Epson c88. So far its been excellent. Also had no trouble buying some re-manufactured ink for it. I had no trouble installing it, I just plugged it into the desktop (its not a wireless) and while I was busy reading a pamphlet wondering what do I do now, Windows 10 set it all up. I think that was the happiest I have ever been when I've had to set up some new device or software! Its also very quiet and fast.
customer_reviews.author: A. Wilhelm

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk
customer_reviews.text: Did not even last one year. Stopped printing in black with the black cartridge still half full. I performed all the software cleaning options and no help. Took out black cartridge to look for leakage or defects, nothing. It is cheaply priced because it is a cheap piece of junk. HP printers have really gone down in quality over the years. How sad.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Z

customer_reviews.title: It prints
customer_reviews.text: Put in paper, right click and hit print, paper comes out. Yes, it's that simple. I just needed something to print papers for school, none of that bluetooth/million different ways to copy/fax machine/with a million buttons I will never click bullshit. It is pretty ugly though, especially considering my desk/speakers/peripherals/literally everything else in my room, is black.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Takes a lickin'
customer_reviews.text: I was compelled to write this, because I have always had terrible luck with printers. Every tiny bump or ding and they just don't work properly anymore, if at all - it's maddening. That said, my cats just knocked this thing down and it fell 4 feet to the floor so I expected the worst. And holy crap, IT STILL WORKS PERFECTLY. I don't know what kind of sorcery was used to make this printer, but I am denouncing God and learning black magic.
customer_reviews.author: sai_justin

customer_reviews.title: Biggest Pile of ..
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for a month. I just needed a basic printer for printing documents (nothing fancy, no images) I have ran all the diagnostics on it, cleaned and aligned and it usually prints a mediocre label on the third try using the "best" quality settings. I cannot return since the box has already been burned. It goes through the ink cartridges very quickly. I have printed four quality (and 12 unusable) labels and the black cartridge is already half used. The cartridges are about as much as I paid for the printer. I'd advise you to keep shopping. I know I will be.
customer_reviews.author: JlS

customer_reviews.title: It works about 30% of the time
customer_reviews.text: I can't really complain, I got what I paid for, which is a $38 printer. It has problems feeding paper. Most of the time after I click "print' it just clicks over and over, trying to grab the paper, but it just can't.
customer_reviews.author: ctescar

customer_reviews.title: Shameless
customer_reviews.text: Set up the printer and began using it yesterday. Printed maybe a hundred pages. Then ran out of black ink. I know the business model is to make the printer inexpensive and gauge the consumer on ink costs -- but this is getting ridiculous. Is it really necessary for me to pay twenty dollars for every hundred pages of plain text that I print? Come on, HP. A dot matrix printer was more effective. I wish the developers of this kind of technology thought more about the consumer's needs and less about their profits. Really outrageous.
customer_reviews.author: WhatIAssume

customer_reviews.title: Listing misleading
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this printer because all it did was print, it was small and light, and did not need to worry about wireless printing. The listing stated that an instant ink subscription could be activated after purchase. The main reason for this particular printer was to have the ink subscription. When I followed the link and tried to set up an account the printer we received is not listed on the ink subscription so, worthless for my needs. The listing no longer offers the subscription, but clearly it did before as I was sent a link right after my purchase. Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Aimee

customer_reviews.title: I'm really sad to find out that I am past the window ...
customer_reviews.text: This is NO DEAL. I am determined that this printer was made to break after printing 200+/- pages of printing. I'm really sad to find out that I am past the window of return! The black ink started malfunctioning... then it just stop printing any part from the black ink. I purchased more ink only to find that it is the printer itself. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: joseph

customer_reviews.title: Not What I'd call "Compact"
customer_reviews.text: The printer works fine, looks "stylish" and fold down somewhat when not is use but it is larger than my old, "non-compact" printer. This printer was purchased as a replacement for another HP printer that died (different model) and naturally, the cartridges are different. It would be nice if there was a standard size cartridge for each brand but ......
customer_reviews.author: Michael W. Erb

customer_reviews.title: This printer can handle tough jobs
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased this printer, I was looking for something inexpensive that would work well with my HP desktop computer. I knew that the printer would be a light weight but figured it would work well for limited printing needs. To my surprise, this simple printer is a strong work horse. I ended up having to do some prolonged printing inclusive of photos and graphs. This printer was able to handle the work load with out going through a lot of ink and the printing was crisp and the colors true to the original work. I would have given it five stars but it is noisier than what I prefer. Overall, definitely well worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Eric Samples

customer_reviews.title: Not all there
customer_reviews.text: If there is no way to connect a printer to a computer it’s just a pile of useless plastic. Day three still trying to get ALL THE PARTS this junk pos I bought. Not ever town has a store to run out to. Crap company whoever they are in China to put this on the market. Crap HP. No wonder nobody likes your product anymore. Shame on you.
customer_reviews.author: WyogalTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Thank you HP for keeping it simple.
customer_reviews.text: I have been through lots of printers. None of them were dependable and were just too complicated for what I need, which is just to print out documents. I dont want a "does everything" wireless printer, just the good old 'plug the cord in and print". I thought they stopped making them. Then, I found this unit, and so happy I did. All you have to do is plug in the AC and USB cables, download the software from the HP website, put the ink in, stick some paper in, and you are ready to print. Thank you HP.
customer_reviews.author: Nats

customer_reviews.title: Expectations were low. And still weren't met.
customer_reviews.text: You don't expect much from a $30 printer, but yet, this still managed to underwhelm. It takes forever to start printing, occasionally fails to recognize that you tried to print something (which requires me to cancel the print job and restart the printer multiple times), and didn't come with the needed USB cable (Note: if a device requires a cord of some sort - please just include it and charge the additional $1 it probably costs. Requiring a separate trip/purchase is just annoying. They lost a star for that inconvenience). Print quality is not great. It's readable and will work for shipping labels (which is what I plan on using it for), but probably not much else.
customer_reviews.author: StrBellydSneetch

customer_reviews.title: We use these on a ship, they're great!
customer_reviews.text: I'm an oceanographer. We needed a printer and a backup printer for our lab on the ship. Picked up two of these, and they come to sea with us every month for a week, and then stay in a box between expeditions. They work flawlessly every time. I liked them so much at work I bought one for home. Ours have survived a total of 35 days out in the middle of the Pacific Ocean, including the humidity, without problems. We have no issue with the cartridge tips (or whatever the technical term is) drying up, and they keep on trucking even after weeks in storage. Great price too.
customer_reviews.author: K. Rosburg

customer_reviews.title: Had this happen with pretty much any HP printer I've had in the past
customer_reviews.text: Rarely ever wants to feed the paper. Had this happen with pretty much any HP printer I've had in the past. It's amazing to me that a company that's been around this long and made it's name on printers, still can't make a printer that feeds correctly every time it's used.
customer_reviews.author: losinsanity

customer_reviews.title: Simple, great product!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using my printer for a week now and it is perfect. I bought it for my classroom, it is the perfect size. Was particularly glad I could use black ink without inserting colored ink as my order for XL color had not arrived. Color quality is beautiful. No jamming. Plugged it in to the wall then the computer and it was a go! **Definitely note you need your own USB plug, I used my old HP plug. I don't notice noise being any issue and speed is pretty decent. Definitely recommend this cute and simple printer!
customer_reviews.author: Bookmaven

customer_reviews.title: Lasted only for a couple of months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer because I had the exact same one before which lasted 8 years. When I bought this printer, I thought this one will last almost as the previous one, but unfortunately after a couple of months, the printer broke down. Now it is leaking ink all over the desk. Tried to change the ink cartridge but apparently the problem is from the printer itself. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sam W.

customer_reviews.title: Worst printer ever- don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Unless my printer came broken somehow, this is the worst printer I have EVER used. I have yet to get through 1 print job (even those that are just 1 page) without having a paper jam or the ink cartridge get stuck. I even tried changing the cartridge and using different HP Paper. Nothing worked. I finally returned the product. I don't even want to replace this printer with another HP product. When the pages did print, they had ink marks all over (even after changing the cartridge). I ended up having to spend $30 to print color pages at the local business shop.
customer_reviews.author: AC2007

customer_reviews.title: IT DOES NOT COME WITH THE USB CABLE. YOU HAVE TO SPEND ANOTHER 6-7 BUCKS TO GET ONE
customer_reviews.text: I can't describe how iritated I was to open the box the printer came in only to discover there was NO CORD TO CONNECT THE DEVICE TO MY COMPUTER. It turns out they don't come with one! This information should be front and center for all to plainly see. I would have bought another printer had I known I was going to have to shell out another 6-7 dollars for a cable that has come with every printer I have ever bought. Regardless of this little scam, the printer thus far is decent. I don't know how long the ink will last so I will update you when I have more information about it.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Sala

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased this printer about a year ago I never got to using it. I just recently popped it open you plugged it in. I installed the drivers and software and installed the ink. Every time I print there are large sections of text missing. I've done all the diagnostics cleaned everything and gone through countless problem solving things on the HP website. I bought a cheap printer hoping to have a frill free easy printing experience. That did not happen. Stay away from this dud printer.
customer_reviews.author: Wmac

customer_reviews.title: not wireless
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for a college student dorm, so the lower quality wasn't a concern. However, it seemed to indicate that it was a wireless system, and could be printed to from computer or app. It is not. It needs an additional USB cord to connect to a computer, and it is not compatible with the hp smart app. Quality-wise, it is extremely lightweight, no screens or buttons, and the paper roller is weak, so paper must be pushed in so it can grab it. Over all, not bad for printing papers, but not good for anything else.
customer_reviews.author: TX mom

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely awful. Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: All kinds of issues--prints blurry pages; discolored; buggy operations. Even the software is terrible. Be very careful to uncheck the numerous pre-checked boxes that trick you into installing bloatware and sending data to HP. The worst part? At the end of the install, you are FORCED to answer survey questions about yourself like your location! You cannot x out of the window, and need to force close it! Incredibly annoying design. I'm never buying an HP printer just for that reason alone.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Adultman

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Printer worked the first few times I used it, then all of a sudden didn’t anymore. I always print from PDF, suddenly it started printing blank pages, or pages with a couple lines on it but mostly blank. Wish I had spent the extra money on a wireless
customer_reviews.author: Raigen Huss

customer_reviews.title: Still trying to get it to print
customer_reviews.text: If I ever get this thing to work, I may come back and write a better review. The instructions are pictures, very badly drawn and requiring a good imagination to figure out. The connection to my Mac was not difficult, and according to my system readings the printer should work. It doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: Francine

customer_reviews.title: It broke 12 days after warranty expired
customer_reviews.text: I bought it at beginning of October and by mid-January, after printing maybe 15 pages on it during that time, the paper feeder stopped feeding. I know it is a cheap product, but it was the only one small enough to fit in the space I have for it. I expected to get a year out of it before it broke at least - not three months. Furious. It printed at an acceptable, but not prettily, before that.
customer_reviews.author: Trinity A. Greer

customer_reviews.title: I
customer_reviews.text: I am missing one of the wires and the other thing is it won't install into my computer yet. I had my dad literally in and out of the doctor's offices and in and out of the hospital twice and they closed the window for me to return the printer on January 31, 2019. This is not right at all. $20.00 is best what I used to make by working unhurt off for one day out of my ton of day 's of working for McDonald's. This is not right at all! Where would I send this, too, anyway?
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you don’t need to scan or fax this inexpensive printer is a great option.
customer_reviews.text: We needed an inexpensive lightweight printer to have on hand in our RV. We rarely need to print things out when we’re on a road trip but when we do, we’d have to find a Staples or Office Max to do it for us. This small printer doesn’t have any additional features but it is perfect for printing a few pages when you need it to.
customer_reviews.author: Maryann Newman

customer_reviews.title: Very nice basic printer
customer_reviews.text: After owning all-in-one printers in the past and having one feature of them always eventually fail, I just wanted a basic inkjet printer that only printed. The HP DeskJet 1112 Compact Printer is the answer. I selected this particular model because I trust the HP brand, and the price was unbeatable. I'm very surprised and satisfied at the print quality. If you want a quiet printer, this is not the one for you, but for the price I don't care that it sounds like a lawn mower.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Hoffman Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Skip it!
customer_reviews.text: Do yourself a favor and skip this printer. I’ve had this for almost a year and have used it 3 times. Just went to print something and it’s only printing half of the text. Just installed brand new cartridges and did an entire reboot, clean, and install. I’m still having the same problem. Also, the fact that I had to purchase a USB cable separately is ridiculous. How cheap can you be, HP? You should be embarrassed that a product like this, with your name on it, is out on the market.
customer_reviews.author: FLChic

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: loves ink - you won't get much printed before it's out. I use regular printer paper from Staples and this little printer started with the paper jams right out of the box. Waste of money in my opinion, didn't even bother buying another ink cartridge for it - headed to the landfill. Brother has a little mono laser printer that puts this one to shame.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Guza

customer_reviews.title: Nothing like the older HP printers
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace an older HP Inkjet that lasted for years and was a real workhouse. This one is nothing like that. It's cheaply made and kind of jerky when printing, but it does the job if you're just printing an occasional page or so. I would not recommend it for anyone with heavy printing duties like a manuscript or long report. I don't want an all in one (I already have a very good scanner) so the choices are limited. Why can't someone make a solid printer that's simply a printer?
customer_reviews.author: book lover

customer_reviews.title: If I could give this printer 1/2 star I would
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer at the last second, before school started. I was ok that it wasn't wireless(as I live in a duplex and it's not that big of a deal to plug in my laptop to the printer). I do have an issue that the cord doesn't come with the printer, the cord you need to connect your laptop to the printer, I have also had a lot of problems with the paper getting stuck and with that the printer shuts itself off. If you have the money and time, just buy a nicer printer.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Sweet

customer_reviews.title: No color
customer_reviews.text: When I worked for HP, their installation program was unreliable and unclear. This is reliable and unclear; progress. I doubt the average consumer will get this installed without tech support. Worse, it is not printing in color, nor is there any obvious explanation for why. It also appears that printing one test page requires powering the printer off and on again. Tomorrow will be spent with HP tech support. HP tech support agreed printer was defective.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton E. Cramer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality printer
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Exactly what I wanted. A small, light-weight and good quality printer for my home office. Setup took no longer than ten minutes. I then printed a test page and it was printed before I could blink! Quality of photo's is very good and also fast. Although I have Prime, this printer was shipped a few hours after I ordered it and arrived in less than 24 hours!
customer_reviews.author: Helena

customer_reviews.title: Why the decit?
customer_reviews.text: Why not upfront tell buyers a connecting cable is needed? I will not know for two more days whether or not the printer functions. I have to now wait on the connecting cable So one star only.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Ledford

customer_reviews.title: too cheap to operate properly
customer_reviews.text: used for 3 months and it stopped printing --It would make the noise like it was printing --but the paper was blank-- Tried everything --then I tried cleaning the print heads and the same thing happened --blank sheet where the print out was supposed to tell me if the printheads needed cleaning or not--Tried replacing the ink cartridges--they would come but new ones would not go in the opening --quit trying after 15 minuets --can not understand why the cartridges would not go in --Never happened with the other 5 or so HP printers i have purchased that were 8600 series and above this one 1112 was just too cheaply built --Save your money and buy better quality
customer_reviews.author: Doyle H.

customer_reviews.title: I bought this printer last NOV
customer_reviews.text: Hi..I bought this printer last Nov and it died n Oct. So I thouight I would get a wireless high ennd Cannon.....well I couldntt get it to sink with my router...problems...so I sent itt back annd Re-orrderred my trusty Hp and bought the einsurrance for only 3.50 for 4 years....much happiier....
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Weeden

customer_reviews.title: Will not Feed Paper
customer_reviews.text: Paper feeds through only 1/10 times. Probably less. Then the computer says "out of paper". I've tried filling the tray with a lot of paper, a little bit, one sheet, several sheets. Nothing. It only feeds through when it feels like it. Not to mention that when it does actually print, it prints about a quarter of the page. Full ink. Super tight, HP. Sick. Super dope.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't include $2 part to make it work.
customer_reviews.text: I just got my printer in the mail. Set it all up and started looking for the cable to connect it to my laptop. Nothing else in the box, so I came here for help. Apparently I should have read the fine print, because now I find out they don't include a cheap, basic part to make this thing work. What a joke. I have the engine on my truck tore down working on it, so maybe next week I'll be able to go pick up the $2 part HP was too cheap to include. American manufacturing at its finest.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Have correct USB cord for printer.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. no bells and whistles. Just hook it to a computer, download the software or use the disk and get a nice print job. Make sure you have a printer USB cord. Squarish on one end. Looks like a tiny shed. Instructions are one page on both sides no words just pictures. Easy.
customer_reviews.author: Don Langston

customer_reviews.title: Gets er done, until it doesn't.
customer_reviews.text: For 30 bucks, it came through in a pinch. The ink costs more than the printer. Lol. *edit* after about 4 months of fairly light use (I'm still on the ink/toner starters it came with), it's now a non-dependable product. I'm going to be contacting HP about a warranty issue. It randomly doesn't want to print anything and has to be cycled on and off again.
customer_reviews.author: HeHatesTheseCans

customer_reviews.title: A GREAT PRINTER AT ANY PRICE .. ON TODAYS MARKET...
customer_reviews.text: IF YOU NEED A PRINTER FOR HOME DESKTOP COMPUTER ... I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS LITTLE HP PRINTER... DOES A FANTASTIC JOB !!!.. WILL DO COLOR VERY WELL... VERY LIGHT WEIGHT... SMALL FOOTFRINT... FAST... RELIABLE... INEXPENSIVE TO OPERATE.. HOLDS UP VERY WELL TO USAGE... SUPER EZ TO SET UP AND INSTALL SOFTWARE... QUICK DELIVERY... VERY WELL PACKAGED.. GREAT PRICE... WORKS GREAT WITH WINDOWS 10... OR EVEN WINDOWS XP... VERY-VERY VERSITILE..
customer_reviews.author: JOHNMICHAEL COOPER

customer_reviews.title: Order USB cable separately !!
customer_reviews.text: Did not come with USB cable!! Should be a quality printer but they should make it clear that you will need USB cable to print. Just an additional $6.
customer_reviews.author: Mike J

customer_reviews.title: No usb cable
customer_reviews.text: I didn't happen to see the fine print of not including a cable. Sure, I just bought one for $5, but WTF hp, that would be too hard to include and just ship with the printer in its box? Never bought an device like this without it having everything you need. Just rude.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Nearly Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this little beauty a full 5 stars except it did not come with a driver to install or much of any instructions. But HP's tech support quickly came to the rescue, taking control of my computer and installing the necessary software. It prints superbly and does exactly what it needs to. And you can feed more than one piece of paper at a time. A great value. BTW, if you should run into the missing driver issue, call HP's direct support at 1-833-804-5696.
customer_reviews.author: David J. Pines

customer_reviews.title: Good for occasional but not normal to heavy use
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to complain when the price is so low but, this is one of the slowest printers I have ever utilized. As the print button is utilized the software that operates with the actual printer takes forever to create a file that can actually be printed. Once the ink starts rolling is relatively quick but the delay in between each page as it uploads is far too long for someone who would utilize his printer on a regular basis.
customer_reviews.author: Heather D-L

customer_reviews.title: Terrible. Would not connect to any computers in the ...
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. Would not connect to any computers in the house, with drivers downloaded. Wasted 2 hours and just returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Rozenfeld

customer_reviews.title: Good quality printer for the price
customer_reviews.text: For basic printing I recommend this printer as it works fine. You do have to go online to get the product working, which for some may be a hassle, however in my case, I had no problem setting up my printer and getting it to work. The USB cord was not included, you will have to buy it separate. The ink was included although it is not a lot, I have printed over 30 pages so far before the color started to fade a little bit.
customer_reviews.author: Charles E. Rey

customer_reviews.title: Good printer for the original price, you will spend much more than that on ink
customer_reviews.text: The good: This is a lightweight printer, very inexpensive (for the initial purchase), and generally fine for any day-to-day printing needs. I would have given a much higher rating except for... The bad: I was astounded at how quickly the ink needed replacement, the very first day I used the printer (less than 50 pages). A high capacity replacement cartridge costs more than the actual printer, so the cost of ownership quickly gets much higher.
customer_reviews.author: B. Durrett

customer_reviews.title: almost  just barely useable as shipped
customer_reviews.text: HP has succumbed to the trend of other manufacturers and does not include a USB cable. So, for the purchase prices you get minimal print cartridges and no cable. Not so much of a bargain. Buyers beware. Furthermore, the design for the print cartridges is sophomoric. Unlike other HP models (I've been using their printers since the original Deskjet and Laserjet), these print cartridges require you to be a contortionist. I do believe that they could have made these a bit more awkward to install, but that would have taken work on their part. Best to avoid this printer
customer_reviews.author: Steven E.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect one job hard wired machine.
customer_reviews.text: If you're fed up with giant printer scanner fax monsters with needlessly complicated wifi connections, and just want a simple, easy printer that works great, this is it. USB wire is not included, but if you order one, BAM its working in one minute. Windows 10 auto installs the drivers without you doing anything. Ink cartridges install in a snap. Print quality, even for photos and splashy graphics is crisp, clear, no tread lines. Brilliant! Cannot recommend this printer highly enough. Wish I had bought it years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Melody

customer_reviews.title: Literally the worst printer I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: I got this printer because it's compact and was supposed to be easy to install and use. My experience was the exact opposite. We have encountered endless problems, and have tried using it with multiple computers with different operating systems to see what the best match is. It just doesn't work. Right now it's only printing color despite having a full black ink cartridge in it. We also can't get it to work with any of our macs. It won't even show up when I download the driver and go through the complicated setup process. I hate this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me
customer_reviews.text: Installed with no issues, but after two printings, the printer would not print. Printer showed color ink was out and black ink was full. Checked color ink and it appeared to still be full. I used the printer software to try and fix the problem and got ,"printer busy". This problem would not clear, even after I reinstalled printer software. I bought this printer for a print job where I needed the color, but after six sheets it failed.
customer_reviews.author: John C.

customer_reviews.title: Quick & Easy
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up - plug in and it's ready to use. Doesn't come with a USB cable, but I just used the one from the old printer. Prints come out clear, sharp and fast. The size is a little larger than I expected for a compact printer, but it still fits well on the desk because of the lower profile. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: horrible experience
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer for its size and was pleased when I pulled it out of the box. I have tried everything possible and haven't been able to get my printer to work. it prints but either the images don't show up, have lines through the middle and instead of black I get a very dull gray. The cartridge that came with the printer ran out after printing two test pages, I replaced the ink with genuine HP ink and am still having the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: Christiann Igou

customer_reviews.title: Will Last Less Than a Year
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer and after less than a year with MINIMAL printing, it doesn't print anymore. The printer still works, so I'm sure if I spent more than the printer to get new cartridges, it might work again. Still, I would not expect a printer to only work for 8-9 months....but gave it 2 stars since it worked pretty good initially.
customer_reviews.author: Chris L. Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Serves the purpose and is very inexpensive!
customer_reviews.text: The price was incredibly low and even though it's a little noisy when printing I'm very happy with it. I don't print every day or in huge quantities, so this serves the purpose. Paper loads from the top. Doesn't hold a lot of paper - maybe 25 sheets, tops - but that's not a serious issue for me - I don't print large manuscripts every day. Feels a little flimsy when you pick it up but on the other hand it's fairly lightweight. Does the job and I'm happy I bought it for so little outlay of $$$.
customer_reviews.author: MarthaP

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy Ink runs out instantly
customer_reviews.text: It's a pretty printer but the black ink died after just 50 pages printed, and it takes forever to get it to print, it buffers too much, waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Jerrico Usher

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't Connect Printer to Mac
customer_reviews.text: I would consider myself quite tech savvy, but was unable to connect this printer to my MAC. I wanted a simple printer as needed print jobs, and this simple printer stumped me.
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla

customer_reviews.title: Best cheap printer only unit I've found
customer_reviews.text: If you need a simple, basic printer without all the fancy features, then you've come to the right place. For $20, you can't go wrong. The ink is more expensive than the actual printer itself. It does come with ink, but they are 'setup cartridges' so they don't last very long. Overall, it's totally worth it to me if all you need is basic printer functions. Keep in mind there is no wifi, scanning, copying, or anything else besides printing.
customer_reviews.author: E.P.

customer_reviews.title: good luck
customer_reviews.text: does not work. software appears as hp deskjet 1110. every time I go to print something it does not give me a confirmation or a error message. I am to assume that this is a hardware issue not my computer as I have never had any problems like this before with a wireless device or bluetooth. Absolute garbage save your 30 bucks!
customer_reviews.author: Carol Carmack

customer_reviews.title: little work horse
customer_reviews.text: no frills just does its job great. I have had this for over a year at this point. Just found this old request for a review which I would normally ignore but this little printer is such a little work horse I had to say something good about it.
customer_reviews.author: bossman

customer_reviews.title: Budget printer with the soul of a champion
customer_reviews.text: Prints great and a super tiny footprint for a full-sized printer. Windows 8.1 picked the driver when I hooked it up and no issues since. It's been a while since I've owned a consumer printer, but I'm blown away by how fast this thing can spit out a page with text on it. I've been using it mostly to print sheet music, but I've printed two or three graphics and while they take longer than text, they're also sharp and vivid. I'm satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: emaletk

customer_reviews.title: Okay when it decides to actually work.
customer_reviews.text: Ok printer. When it does actually print the print is good quality HOWEVER-- Works fine with my husband's PC, but only sporadically with my MacBook. Extraordinarily frustrating. Have uninstalled and reinstalled drivers, reset everything there is to reset pretty much every single time I try and print. Guzzles ink like mad as well. Have had it for just over 6 months, use it sporadically (not more than a few pages a week, if even), and have to order ink again for the second time - will be third round of cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: Zsmod

product_meta.title: HP Deskjet 1112 Compact Printer (F5S23A) (F5S23A#B1H)
product_meta.description: Style:PrinterPrinting made simple: No need to wait. Start printing right out of the box with easy setup. Affordable at-home printing: Print more for less, using the worlds no. 1 Printer brand plus original HP ink cartridges. Full of value—print Up to twice as many pages with original HP High-Yield ink cartridges. Reduce your impact: conserve resources—without sacrificing performance A printer that's energy Star certified. Reduce your environmental impact. Count on easy, free cartridge recycling through HP planet partners. Operating temperature range 41 to 104 degree Fahrenheit.
feature_bullets: Main function of this HP color inkjet compact printer: reliable color printing
Reliable USB connection to your computer
Save your space with a compact printer designed to fit on your desk, on a shelf, or anywhere you need it
Reduce your impact: conserve resources—without sacrificing performance—using a printer that’s ENERGY STAR certified
Use Original HP 63 ink cartridges for great result print after print. Original HP ink prints up to 2x the pages as refilled cartridges
Recycle today for a better tomorrow: easily recycle your Original HP ink and toner cartridges for free
Paper sizes supported: Letter; legal; 4x6 in; 5x7 in; 8x10 in; No. 10 envelopes
One-year limited hardware warranty; 24-hour, 7 days a week Web support

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars3,157 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
